title: CaCO3 in eggshells - modification to increase rate

content.question: Which of the following modifications will increase the rate of the reaction the most?

choices.label: Using <math alttext="2.0 molar C H 3 C O O H, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>COOH</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> instead of <math alttext="2.0 molar H C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

Cooling the <math alttext="H C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> to a lower temperature than it was in the original experiment
Reducing the volume of the reaction vessel
Using eggshells that are more finely powdered than those used in the original experiment

content.answer: Using eggshells that are more finely powdered than those used in the original experiment

skill.text: 1.B: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate both particulate-level and macroscopic- level properties.
